instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I've never seen this
threads.message:
I've not seen this first hand. This looks to me like a failed GPU but I thought the NVIDIA chips were solid... <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> causing this?
Maybe VRAM or the GPU or the MUX?

[ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	s-l1600-3.jpg Views:	1 Size:	467.2 KB ID:	38961" type="full" width="30%"]38961._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I've never seen this
threads.message:
[QUOTE="G.Beard, post: 38960"]<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> causing this?
[/QUOTE]

doesnt look like it. usually wouldn't power on or you get black screen. my bet is on VRAM and GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I've never seen this
threads.message: however, I always change that cap whenever I get my hand on that board. check voltage on [URL="https://store.rossmanngroup.com/d3-<CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>-1-piece.html"]<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>[/URL], the voltage should be between 1.35v-1.5v
